perturbation.original_text: "Distributor App(s)" means the following application (and successor versions of such software): the trial version of the WhiteSmoke Writer (currently called WhiteSmoke 2011) available on a worldwide basis, but for the avoidance of doubt shall not mean any other products of Distributor, including without limitation the full paid version of Whitesmoke Writer or any version of Whitesmoke "Translator" software, regardless of whether Whitesmoke Writer incorporates any translation functionality.
perturbation.changed_text: "Distributor App(s)" means the following application (and successor versions of such software): the trial version of the WhiteSmoke Writer (currently called WhiteSmoke 2011) available on a worldwide basis, which includes, without limitation, the full paid version of Whitesmoke Writer and all versions of Whitesmoke "Translator" software, regardless of whether Whitesmoke Writer incorporates any translation functionality.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition explicitly excludes the full paid version and translator software. This perturbation changes the definition to *include* those versions, which directly contradicts the original intent and creates confusion on whether Google is owed compensation for distribution via those channels. This directly affects payment and exclusivity obligations, creating legal uncertainty.
perturbation.contradicted_text: Distributor shall begin distribution of Bundles in accordance with this Agreement ("Launch") within [ * ] days following the Effective Date (the date of such Launch, the "Launch Date"). Beginning on the Launch Date and continuing throughout the Term, Distributor shall ensure that [ * ]Distributor App distributed by or on behalf of Distributor is bundled with the Distribution Products as set out in this Agreement.

perturbation.original_text: All uses of the Google Trademarks, and all goodwill associated therewith, shall inure solely to the benefit of Google.
perturbation.changed_text: All uses of the Google Trademarks, and all goodwill associated therewith, shall inure to the joint benefit of Google and Distributor.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states that all goodwill from the use of Google trademarks benefits Google alone. This perturbation states that goodwill will benefit both Google and the distributor which is contradictory to the original terms. In the event Google and Distributor has any dispute over goodwill, there could be ambiguity to it and further action will be required to seek clarification.
perturbation.contradicted_text: Distributor acknowledges that Google and/or its licensors own all right, title and interest, including all Intellectual Property Rights in and to the Products and the Google Trademarks and all modifications to them. Distributor has, and shall acquire, no rights in the foregoing except those expressly granted by this Agreement. Google shall not be restricted from selling, licensing, modifying, or otherwise distributing the Products and/or the Google Trademarks to any third party.

perturbation.original_text: Google may request that Distributor distribute the latest version of the Distribution Products. Distributor shall begin such distribution within [ * ] following Google's request.
perturbation.changed_text: Google may request that Distributor distribute the latest version of the Distribution Products. Distributor may, at its discretion, begin such distribution within [ * ] following Google's request.
perturbation.explanation: The original text imposes a mandatory obligation on the Distributor to begin distributing the latest version of the Products upon Google's request. This modification makes it optional, changing 'shall' to 'may,' which directly contradicts Google's right to enforce distribution of the latest version. It creates ambiguity around Google's ability to maintain consistent product distribution, quality and compatibility.
perturbation.contradicted_text: Distributor shall comply, and shall ensure that each Third Party Distributor complies, with the Guidelines for Applications set out in Exhibit C.
